title: I think fiora is a fantastically designed champion.
body:
I am not joking, I am not lying, and I am not a Fiora main (seriously, i suck at her. Feed every time). I just think she is a great champion. Her kit fits a fencer. She is mobile, she has ways of avoiding CC and parrying, and has a way of "targeting" enemies. Her whole kit is very unique and different from others. 
i love it. 
Does this mean that she isn't cancer to fight when she is op? No.
Does this mean she is fun to lane against? No, but neither is a good chunk of the roster. 
Does this mean she will always be balanced? Hell no. 
She is different, she is unique, and Riot needs to make more champions like her. Just as long as they aren't as insane on the % max health true damage.

It's *frustrating* play against Fiora when she can dash to the side and proc her passive on you with her Q, but still be far enough away that you can't fight back (with most champions anyways). The Movement Speed and heal Fiora gets from her passive doesn't exactly help with that, either; and even if she misses, her Q will automatically target a minion instead and refund a lot of its cooldown.

Yes, when an enemy is strong it is usually "frustrating" for you. That word can easily be abused.  
 
But what I mean when I say frustrating is that I don't feel like I can fight back in any way, or that I could have done that better. This might be due to lack of knowledge on how to play against certain champions or how to play in certain situations.   
Against Miss Fortune you just don't stand behind low Health minion.   
Against Shaco you try to predict where he'll show up and get your teammates help to shut him down. Vision control is also essential.  
And against Gangplank you can kill his barrels and/or stand far enough away so he doesn't land them on you. 

Against Fiora I only know that I can press myself against a wall if her passive is on my side and that I can play more aggressive if it's behind me. But if I have to walk a bit further out to get a creep she will proc it and there is nothing I can do against that. I can damage her, but she'll heal back up. In the worst case she'll fight back now that she's procced her passive once. It respawns immediately. She'll get another, and then another. I can CC her, but if I only have one source of CC she will be anticipating it. So I need to stay far away and poke her if I can but then I'll lose cs. 

What I would like to see is for Fiora to have to make a decision when proccing her passive. A decision to possibly put herself out of position to get it. I don't feel like she has to right now.
 
That being said, it isn't the worst thing in the game. Fiora isn't hard to deal with anymore in the mid to late game. So ~~ maybe~~ she >probably< should be allowed to be a lane bully.

Her win rate is due to the fact that she's a win-lane, win-fights, lose game sort of champion.

She offers insane amounts of damage and cleanup potential. But she has nothing to offer when taking objectives or dealing with bruisers that go straight for the carries. Fiora can potentially 1v5, but no champion in the game can deal with a well-organized team alone and win. She can blow up the tank, and the ADC can use that moment to crit her to death. Or the enemy mage can wait until her parry is off cooldown to lock her down. It's the fact that Fiora CAN be a threat in team fights, but without CC she's useless when underfed.

That's why starving a Fiora in lane is an effective strategy, especially if your top laner can duel. They can deal with her earlier in the mid game and push the advantage while Fiora is still struggling to stay alive in team fights especially when she has no target to heal off of.
